This is a great update that focuses on quality and speed, but also:

– Touch ID passkey lock to protect your inbox;
– Custom integration with PDF Expert by Readdle, to easily fill in, sign and reply with PDF attachments.

We hope you like the update. If you do – please leave us a review.

We are constantly working to make Spark better for you. In this update you'll find:

- Improved the procedure of email sending when Spark is in background;
- Fixed the issue when snoozed email is returned to Inbox before its due time;
- Improved Touch ID stability.
We hope you like the update. If you do – please leave us a review.

Spark by Readdle gets amazing iOS 11 updates and now supports the new Drag and Drop on iPad!

What’s new?
– Drag links, text, and images from Safari and other apps into Spark to compose email faster;
– Drag PDF attachments from Spark to edit, sign, and send them back;
– Easily drag text from an email and drop it into Notes or any other app.

Now Spark and other Readdle’s apps like PDF Expert, Documents, Scanner Pro, Calendars and Printer Pro are one step closer to a powerful ecosystem that redefines what is possible on your Apple devices.

Our team is constantly working to make Spark better for you. In this update you'll find new amazing features:
– Schedule emails to be sent later – compose emails late at night and schedule them to be sent when the recipients are most likely to read them;
– Email follow-ups – add time-specific reminders to emails so you can follow up, if you don’t get a reply. Always be closing!
– The email composer was completely redesigned for easier navigation between accounts and Cc/Bcc.

This update makes Spark the best email app for professionals and sets a solid ground for the new exciting features in the upcoming releases. Stay tuned!

This update brings you a lot of new features and bug fixes:
- Added help menus for Send Later, Reminders and Snooze features;
- Added alert option for Reminder feature;
- Added new option - Spark Services. It is introduced in Settings and activates Send Later and Notifications features;

Hello, everyone!
As the year comes to a close we wanted to push out one more update that addresses some of the top issues we've seen reported by you.
From all of us at Readdle, have a safe and happy holiday season!

- Fixed huge memory leaks on some specific emails;
- Fixed memory leaks and unnecessary sync operations on some specific email accounts;
- Fixed an issue where Snoozed emails returned to the Inbox ahead of due time;
- Fixed the limitless progress indication issue on some emails;
- And the icing on the cake is about your Inbox that now is loaded much faster than ever before right from the start.

We love hearing from you! Get in touch with us at rdsupport@readdle.com

Hello again, everyone!
We apologize for the back-to-back update, but it turns out there were a couple more bugs that needed squashing.
Rest assured 1.12.3 is the real deal.

- Fixed iOS 9 iCloud login issue;

If you need us you can find us at rdsupport@readdle.com

We’re happy to announce Spark 2.0, the biggest update that changes the way you and your team use email.

**Discuss email privately**
Invite teammates to discuss specific emails and threads. Ask questions, get answers, and keep everyone in the loop.

**Create email together**
For the first time ever, collaborate with your teammates using the real-time editor to compose professional emails.

**Create links to email**
Create secure links to a specific email or conversation. Share the link on Slack, Skype, CRM, or any other medium so your team can see it and collaborate around it.

**New powerful integrations**
Popular 3rd party integrations are now available in Spark: Reminders, 2Do, OmniFocus, Things, Wunderlist, Todoist, Asana, Trello, Bear, and Files.

Take your team collaboration to the next level!

With Apple’s WWDC 2018 right around the corner we didn’t want to throw away our shot at bringing you one more update:

- Corrected a couple minor typos thanks to our eagle-eyed customers. If you still see any oddities in translations, please let us know right away at rdsupport@readdle.com
- Resolved an issue with the stop sharing feature;
- Fixed the issue with duplicated drafts;
- Eliminated the issue with attachments for some specific forwarded emails;
- Loads of small UI improvements;
- A handful of improvements for email sharing;
- Calendar stability.

Many thanks for your feedback!
If you want to thank our tireless team, please write a review on the App Store or recommend Spark to your friends and teammates.

Today we’re bringing you one more update. It turns out there were a couple more bugs that needed squashing.

- Fixed the scenario with emails that can’t be archived;

Details matter. That's why today's update is focused on improving specific details on how you work with email in Spark.

## New
- Editing in Outbox while offline. You can now edit email in Outbox while you’re not connected to the Internet and all of the changes will be saved and sent once you’re back online.
- Improved the collaboration experience in Shared Drafts. You’ll see the name indicators on the top of teammates cursors while editing shared drafts.

## Fixed
- We believe we have fixed the annoying issue with Snoozed and Reminded emails. If not - just let us know right away!
- Fixed an issue with email parsing for specific accounts;
- More improvements for the state restoration of the app when it is opened from background.

We hope you enjoy the update.
Have a delightful, secure, and scrumptious summer!

This update comes with a number of improvements to Spark functionality for personal use and team email.

## NEW
- Allow others to send shared drafts on your behalf. All Spark for Teams users can let their teammates send shared drafts on their behalf.
- Notification preferences for team comments. We’ve added new options to let you control the amount of team notification you get. You can configure to get all comment notifications, only mentions, or group them together on the lock screen.
- Meet a long-hoped-for feature that provides you with an ability to select the part of a thread to be saved or printed. You can now print the entire thread history with details for CC, BCC and To fields. And hyperlinks will remain clickable inside saved PDFs.

## FIXED
- Got rid of “immortal” shared threads. In case you had one of those emails that wouldn’t get archived, now it will behave properly.
- Improved the stability of Spark on 32-bit devices, especially crash exorcism:)

We hope you enjoy the update!
Keep in touch with us at rdsupport@readdle.com and stay tuned for news and exciting features!

Another “spit and polish” release, addressing many of the most common issues you’ve told us about.
Keep the feedback coming!

- Resolves a rare crash that could occur when a user comments on a Shared Draft that has been deleted;
- Also on the Shared Drafts front, Spark now remembers the addresses in the To: field when replying to a Shared Draft;
- If an email arrived whose body started with an image, Spark would tell you it had "No Content." We didn't mean to sound so judgmental;
- Resolves instances where sending a chat message could change the "Received" date for an email thread;
- For some email accounts, once a reminder set on a message fired, it did not always return the message to the Inbox;
- Deleting the draft of a shared email sometimes removed the entire thread from your inbox. That doesn't happen anymore;
- Reminders set on messages sent to people not using Spark would sometimes disappear after receiving a comment on that message from someone on your Team;
- Addresses a variety of issues with the display and handling of notifications;
- Selecting "Save as PDF" would sometimes open the Print dialog instead, which was not very helpful;
- Spark on iPhone X no longer freezes when composing a message if the keyboard is dismissed;
- When printing to PDF an email that does not have a subject, Spark now does a better job handling the naming of the file.

We hope you enjoy this release. As always, you can reach us at rdsupport@readdle.com

iOS 12 support is here with new simplified conference call scheduling in Spark!
## New
- Spark now integrates with most popular conference call services like GoToMeeting, Google Hangouts, Google Meet, and Zoom. You can add conference call link to any event without ever leaving Spark. Just log in to the service of your choice and add links with one tap when you create or edit an event - highly recommend for the busiest of us!
- Your lock screen will look clean, neat and lets you stay focused. On iOS 12 Spark supports Group Notifications. This is optional and can be set up in Spark Settings.
- Spark also supports one simple Siri shortcut to help you send email faster. Immediately after you send an email to someone in Spark, go to iOS Settings -> Siri & Search and find Spark in Suggested shortcuts to save an intent for later use. This is just one of the shortcuts we could think of, so we’re waiting for your great ideas on how we can make it even more useful for you.

We hope you enjoy this release.
As always, you can reach us at rdsupport@readdle.com

This update fixes some of the issues you guys reported and makes Spark a little bit better.

FIXED:
* Zoom sign in with Google account is fixed. Now it takes even less time to add Zoom in Spark.
* Somehow parts of the Dark Mode made it to iOS. It wasn’t intentional and we fixed search UI issues right away. While on it, we’ve also improved search speed for some specific cases.
* Apple Watch connectivity with your iPhone should work better now.
* Fixes and stability improvements to make Spark better.
* In rare cases, Spark could show an empty background - we tracked this down and resolved too.

We hope you enjoy this release. Reach us at rdsupport@readdle.com for feedback and comments.

嘿 Siri，Spark 有哪些新功能？

此次 Spark 更新推出全新 Siri 捷径，现在您可设置自动化流程：打开特定文件夹、搜索邮件、编辑正文。
+ 打开文件夹：您若将待办事项保存在置顶，可为此文件夹创建一个捷径：“嘿 Siri，打开 Spark 的置顶邮件”。
+ 搜索邮件：出差人士可创建一个搜索邮件的捷径，用来搜索来自爱彼迎或携程的邮件，以便集中查看酒店预定信息。
+ 撰写邮件：您若经常向特定收件人组别发送邮件，可为此创建一个捷径。那么，下次您只需说：“嘿 Siri，向此群组发送邮件！”即可。
希望这些捷径对您有所帮助，体验自动化带来的便利。

您的满意是我们的追求。
请随时发邮件至 rdsupport@readdle.com 提出意见。更多功能，敬请期待!

Hey Siri, what’s new in Spark?

The latest update brings amazing new Siri Shortcuts to Spark. You can now automate the process of opening a specific folder, searching for email or composing a message to someone.
+ Open any folder: if you keep all your to-dos inside Pins, create a shortcut to this folder with a phrase like ‘Hey Siri: “Open Pinned email in Spark.”
+ Search email: frequent travelers can create a shortcut for searching all emails from Airbnb/Booking.com to see your reservations.
+ Compose an email. Create a shortcut for composing an email to specific people if you email them often. Next time, you’ll just have to say: ‘Hey Siri, email my team!’
We hope these shortcuts will help you automate routine tasks and focus on what really matters.

Meet email templates in Spark!
They’re a perfect way to save your time with messages you write on a regular basis: project updates, billing info, or simple instructions.

- Pre-write an email you send frequently;
- Add attachments;
- Include placeholders for the recipient’s name;
- Re-use it when needed, changing just a few words.

Also, we’ve removed the Readdle branding in Quick Replies so that your emails look more professional, and added the ability to attach videos when composing a message.
Last but not least, we fixed about 50 small things here and they are related to snooze and reminders, calendar sync, and integrations with other apps.
To unleash the full power of iOS 12 within Spark and provide you with the best experience, we need to drop support for iOS 10.
Please update your devices to the latest iOS version if you want to receive further updates of Spark.

We hope you’ll love the update as much as we do!
Keep the feedback coming at rdsupport@readdle.com and stay tuned for news and exciting features.

Today's update brings you a handful of important fixes and performance improvements.

Let's dive into the release note:

- Odd scenario when snoozed emails due to unstable Internet connection returned to your Inbox earlier than they should. This should no longer happen, we promise.

We hope you love the update as much as we do!

Meet the all-new writing experience in Spark!

[NEW]
Meet rich text formatting - tweak emails to look the way you want with colors, highlights, and other formatting options. Now you can format your long and thoughtful emails in new ways to emphasize the most important ideas.

[FIXED]
For everyone out there using custom keyboards like Gboard or SwiftKey, we improved their performance in Spark.
We've also invested a ton of time and effort in stabilizing and improving email drafts experience as well as shared drafts for team users. With this update, drafts will no longer be duplicated. The shared drafts are now loading much faster and should not get stuck in the Outbox on sending. Also, in case you were writing really-really-really long emails, the maximum size for shared drafts was also increased.
We hope you enjoy the update as much as we do!

Keep the feedback coming at rdsupport@readdle.com
More exciting features are coming soon!

Introducing Email Delegation!
As the CEO, founder, manager, or anyone who works with a team, it's likely you delegate tasks to your teammates. The new email delegation in Spark lets you assign emails to your teammates, add due dates, and keep track of their progress.
Your teammates will find all of the delegated messages in their inbox and a dedicated "Assigned to me" section. You'll get notified instantly when the tasks are completed.
* Delegation is available for everyone using Spark for Teams.

Besides Delegation, our designers have dramatically redesigned the sidebar in the app. Now you can:
- Create new folders and add Smart folders right from the sidebar;
- Personalize your sidebar easier and with more options;
- Finally, swipe from the left edge of the screen to open the sidebar. :)

We hope you enjoy the update as much as we do.
Keep in touch with us at rdsupport@readdle.com and stay tuned for new exciting features!

Hello folks!
Today’s update is all about new features and a number of "quality of life" improvements to Spark.
## NEW
- Added Strikethrough tool in the email composer. Finally!
- Added the possibility to attach an inline image in the email composer. Just tap and hold on the place in the composer where you want the image to be inserted and voilà!
- Starting today you can tell the world that you've reached Inbox Zero in Spark by tweeting the screen of your empty Inbox with a hashtag: Loving my #inboxzero with Spark
Just give it a try!
- A new signature editor is at your service now!

Thank you to everyone who got in touch at rdsupport@readdle.com and let us know these features were important to them. We really appreciate it.

Use More Fonts When Writing Email!
The most recent update allows you to select various fonts and pick text size to compose the best email.
It’s a long time anticipated feature for personal and professional use.
Now you can:

- Use a variety of fonts and sizes in email composer;
- Set a default font type and size for all your messages. As soon as you change font settings, Spark will remember it and use for all future messages;
- Apply other formatting options like text color and highlight to new fonts;
- Tweak your signatures with variety of fonts available to match your style.

We hope you enjoy the update as much as we do.
Keep in touch with us at rdsupport@readdle.com and stay tuned for new exciting features!

Welcome to the all-new Spark!
Our team has put a tremendous effort to redesign Spark from scratch and bring the best email experience for professionals and their teams.

*** Slick New Design
Spark now feels impressively smooth, effortless, yet super powerful to help you love your email again.

*** Enjoy the stylish Dark Mode
We've carefully selected the colors to help you work better at night and save battery life. Select the Dark or a truly Black mode in Personalization settings > Color Scheme.

*** Inbox with Avatars
Now it’s a lot easier to breeze through your emails with people’s photos or company logos next to the emails. Turn them on/off in Spark Settings > Personalization > Color Scheme.

*** Customize Email Actions
Select which email actions are displayed at the bottom of an email to fit your personal Inbox workflow better and create the experience you love.

*** Multiple windows support on iPad
Open two Spark windows side by side on your iPad. Why? You could open a long email on the left and compose a response on the right, without the need of going back and forth.

*** Sync of contacts on all your devices
You can now label an email address as an important one on iPhone and it will be automatically defined as important on your Mac or iPad.

Beyond these major new features we’ve also included a handful of important bug fixes and enhancements:

- Fixed a rare but annoying issue with wrong email titles
- Fixed a bug where some emails disappeared during the search
- Fixed a problem with the incorrect name of video attachments
- Fixed an issue with timestamp format
- Fixed crash on watchOS 4
- Fixed incorrect email rendering for peculiar cases
- Fixed the keyboard selection in the email lists
- Improved email sync stability.

We hope you love this update as much as we’ve loved making it.
If you need us you can find us at rdsupport@readdle.com

Now you can change the font size of UI in Spark and add CC/BCC people in email templates.

Today we’re bringing you a fantastic update with a long-wished-for feature – Shared Inboxes!
Now Spark lets you handle an inbox together with multiple people, assign emails just like tasks, set deadlines, and track progress. No email will slip through the cracks! This feature is invaluable for small teams like info@, sales@, or support@. 

What you can do with Shared Inboxes:
- Grant access to other people, without sharing passwords
- Assign emails to others or yourself, just like tasks
- Set deadlines and track progress 
- Discuss emails with others in a private chat
- Write emails together in real time
Install the update and let us know what you think about Shared Inboxes at support@sparkmailapp.com. It makes a huge difference to us. Thank you in advance!
